textBox.richText: Wall-Floor Features for Lateral Collision Avoidance

This is another attempt to enable indoor autonomous flight on an ARDrone. I worked with Kyel Ok in this project. Kyel, now a student at MIT, is a very good friend of mine with a great desire and talent to make things work. Vistas are good for straight flight, but we need the wall information to avoid lateral collisions. Due to the limitations of vertical edges, I tried to make use of more salient information in the images. The wall-floor intersection lines are great candidates, so I look for intersections between vertical edges and the wall-floor intersection lines. These features encode the wall structure and are easy to detect using steerable filters as shown in the video below.
